wikipedia_page.main: Stafford Henry Northcote, 1st Earl of Iddesleigh  (27 October 1818 – 12 January 1887), known as Sir Stafford Northcote, Bt from 1851 to 1885, was a British Conservative politician. He served as Chancellor of the Exchequer between 1874 and 1880 and as Foreign Secretary between 1885 and 1886, and was one of only two people to hold the office of First Lord of the Treasury without ever being Prime Minister (the other being William Henry Smith, his successor-but-two, who, like Iddesleigh, also served in post in one of the Salisbury ministries).

response: * January 12 – Stafford Northcote, 1st Earl of Iddesleigh, British politician (b. 1818)
